title: Russia Is Adapting Arms and Tactics Ahead of Ukraine Offensive
description: Russia’s military has changed the way it fights 15 months into its disastrous invasion of Ukraine and poses a significant threat as Kyiv prepares a major counteroffensive, a study released Friday said.

title: Trump Bashes ‘Pro-China’ Biden Even as US Stance Has Hardened
description: US President Joe Biden has largely stuck with his predecessor’s tough economic line against China, and even taken it a bit further. But that’s not how Donald Trump is telling it.

title: G-7 to Chase Russia’s Diamonds While Stopping Short of Total Ban
description: Group of Seven countries will agree to work together to track Russian diamonds, but stop short of slapping Moscow with an outright ban on the lucrative gem trade, according to people familiar with the discussions and a draft statement seen by Bloomberg.

title: Rishi Sunak Strikes More Cautious Tone on AI in Call for G-7 Regulation
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said Group of Seven countries will coordinate on artificial intelligence regulations, in a sign that some leaders are becoming more nervous about the potential dangers posed by the technology.

title: US and Taiwan Agree on Trade Initiative in Bid for Closer Ties
description: The US and Taiwan agreed to boost trade ties, the first tangible results under an initiative announced last year that faces vehement opposition from Beijing.

title: Social Media Win in Court Leaves Open Immunity Question
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, legal reporter Emily Birnbaum assesses the outlook for social media after today’s Supreme Court ruling. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Ecuador’s President Dissolved Congress to Avoid Impeachment. Here’s What That Means
description: Ecuador’s President Guillermo Lasso, a wealthy former banker who’s popular among investors, found a way to fend off almost certain impeachment by the opposition-controlled congress: He dissolved the body. That set off Article 148 of the country’s constitution, a provision known as “mutual death,” which means new elections for president and the congress. In the meantime, Lasso rules by decree. Fears of a return to socialist rule and nationwide protests sent Ecuador’s bonds into a tailspin, leavin

title: The Supreme Court Just Handed Google and Twitter a New Line of Defense
description: The US Supreme Court handed social media companies a new line of defense as they face an increasing number of lawsuits alleging their algorithms have harmed users — whether by addicting children or selling suicide kits.

title: Kyrsten Sinema Is ‘More and More Confident’ of Deal to Avoid US Debt Default
description: Senator Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona said she’s “more and more confident” of a deal to avert a US default.

title: Treasury’s Coffers Dwindle to Lowest Since 2021 Under Debt Cap’s Shadow
description: The amount of money the US government has to pay its bills dwindled to the lowest since December 2021, deepening concern that it will run out of funds by early next month if the debt limit isn’t raised or suspended before then.

title: Yellen Tells Bank CEOs Debt-Limit Failure Would Be Catastrophic
description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen told top bank executives Thursday that a failure to raise the debt ceiling would be “catastrophic” for the financial system, reiterating that the matter should be addressed without delay.

title: Japan’s New Military Might Is Rising in a Factory in Hiroshima
description: As the country rearms, the city of peace once again becomes a defense hub.

title: G-7 Nations Will Ramp Up Pressure on Russia With New Sanctions, Restrictions
description: The Group of Seven nations will increase pressure on Russia with additional sanctions as well as restrictions on goods it uses on the battlefield, according to a senior Biden administration official.

title: Here’s How the Debt-Limit Deal Is Looking as Talks Go Down to the Wire
description: Speaker Kevin McCarthy stoked optimism on Thursday about a US debt-limit deal getting reached on Capitol Hill, after negotiations narrowed to top staffers for McCarthy and President Joe Biden.

title: Supreme Court Drops Title 42 Border Case After Policy Scrapped
description: The US Supreme Court scrapped a showdown over pandemic-era border restrictions after President Joe Biden’s administration ended the emergency declaration that had formed policy’s legal basis.

title: Disney Will Outlast DeSantis in Florida, Orlando Mayor Says
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis is fighting a losing battle against Walt Disney Co., and a backlash against the Republican’s culture crusade is galvanizing Democrats across the state, Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer said.

title: Conservative House Freedom Caucus Urges End to Debt Talks, Senate Vote on GOP Bill
description: The hardline conservative House Freedom Caucus called for an end to bipartisan talks to raise or suspend the federal debt limit, insisting instead that the Senate vote on the House Republican bill passed in April.

title: Biden Faces Progressive Backlash Against Any Debt-Limit Concessions
description: President Joe Biden faces a fervent campaign from progressive Democrats opposing potential concessions to Republicans to avert a US default, complicating passage of a debt-limit deal and risking enthusiasm for his reelection.

title: Warren Blasts Regulators Over First Republic Sale to JPMorgan
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren blasted federal regulators for their handling of the recent demise of First Republic Bank, including the decision to sell the failed lender to JPMorgan Chase & Co.

title: Key McCarthy Ally McHenry Says Debt Deal ‘Not Close’
description: House Financial Services Chairman Patrick McHenry emerged from debt talks on Thursday saying the two sides are “not close to being done” with a deal to avert a first-ever US default.

title: White House Tells Debt-Limit Negotiators to Protect Gains on Drug Prices, Climate
description: White House negotiators meeting with Republicans to hash out a deal to avert a historic US default have been instructed not to offer concessions on drug pricing, access to health care, or programs to combat climate change, Lael Brainard, the president’s top economic adviser, said Thursday.

title: Air Force Starts Multibillion-Dollar Contest for New Fighter Jet
description: The Air Force formally opened a multibillion-dollar contest to replace the F-22 Raptor fighter jet that’s likely to draw competing bids by US aerospace giants Lockheed Martin Corp., Boeing Co. and Northrop Grumman Corp.

title: Saudi Arabia Welcomes Assad in Diplomatic Win for Syrian Leader
description: Syrian President Bashar Al Assad touched down in Saudi Arabia to attend an Arab League summit for the first time in 13 years, marking a victory for a leader sanctioned by the US for war atrocities.

title: Top US Bank Regulators Promise Fast Action on Executive Bonuses and Pay
description: The top US bank regulators are vowing to act quickly on long-delayed rules to clamp down on executive pay and bonuses.

title: New Pentagon Missile Defense Radar Is Delayed and Over Budget, GAO Says
description: Delivery of Lockheed Martin Corp.’s new ground radar for the US system in Alaska intended to track and intercept missiles from North Korea or Iran will be delayed by more than a year, according to congressional auditors.

title: US Green Lights UN’s Venezuela Fund in Boost to Negotiations
description: The US government has assured the United Nations that contributions to its humanitarian fund for Venezuela will be safe from seizure by creditors, a reversal that could allow the relief effort to begin operating as soon as this month, according to eight people with knowledge of the dealings.

title: More Than 300 Firms Seek Slice of $39 Billion in US Chips Funds
description: The number of companies seeking funds from a $39 billion US program to promote semiconductor production has surpassed 300 in a new milestone for an initiative to shore up American manufacturing of high-tech supplies.

title: Biden Intends to Pick Lawyer Anna Gomez for FCC to End Agency Deadlock
description: President Joe Biden intends to select veteran government lawyer Anna Gomez to serve on the Federal Communications Commission and give the agency its first Democratic majority of his presidency, a person briefed on the matter said.

title: Russia Changes Rules to Allow Elections Under Martial Law
description: Russian lawmakers passed measures to permit elections to take place under martial law, as the Kremlin prepares for a series of regional votes and a potential fifth presidential term for Vladimir Putin amid the war in Ukraine.

title: Turkey's Lira Defense in Week Before Vote Shrank Forex Reserves by Record
description: Turkey’s gross foreign exchange reserves posted a record fall in the week before Sunday’s inconclusive elections, as the central bank expanded efforts to support the lira.

title: Supreme Court Leaves Intact Social Media Liability Shield in Win for Google, Twitter
description: The US Supreme Court left in place a broad liability shield for social media companies for content posted by users, insulating Twitter Inc., Facebook Inc. and Google LLC from claims that they provided assistance to Islamic State terrorists.

title: McCarthy Predicts US Debt-Limit Deal on House Floor Next Week
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said that negotiators on the federal debt limit may reach an agreement in principle as soon as this weekend and that he expects his chamber to consider a deal by next week.

title: Ecuador Weighs August Election After Dissolution of Congress
description: Ecuador’s electoral authority says it could hold new elections within three months after President Guillermo Lasso took the unprecedented step of dissolving Congress on Wednesday.

title: Chile’s Economy Bounces Back as Recession Concerns Dissipate
description: Chile’s economic growth picked up at the start of the year, as resilient consumer spending buoyed the recovery from recession.

title: Estonian Premier Urges EU Ban on Transit Through Russia
description: Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas called for a full ban on the transit of European Union goods through Russia amid concerns that a spike in trade with third countries is facilitating sanctions evasion.

title: Turkey Criticizes US For Sending Naval Ship to Cyprus
description: Turkey criticized the US for sending a warship to the divided island of Cyprus this week, accusing Washington of heightening tensions in the eastern Mediterranean.

title: Erdogan Rival Kilicdaroglu Hardens Stance Before Runoff Vote in Turkey
description: ANKARA, Turkey (AP) — President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s main challenger in Turkey’s presidential race shifted gear and adopted a more nationalist and hard-line stance on Thursday, vowing to send back millions of refugees if he is elected and rejecting any possibility of negotiating for peace with Kurdish militants.

title: Biden, G-7 Partners to Focus on China in Hiroshima Gathering
description: President Joe Biden and his G-7 counterparts will spend a considerable amount of time discussing China at their gathering in Hiroshima, National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said Thursday.

title: The Challenges Are Piling Up for UK’s Rishi Sunak
description: Who’d want to be Rishi Sunak? Even his detractors admire his hardworking and measured approach to policy making since he became UK prime minister in October, but it’s simply not enough.

title: South Korea Concerned a Republican Win May Lower IRA Tax Credits
description: South Korea believes the US may reduce the tax credits in President Joe Biden’s landmark clean energy law, which encourages automakers to manufacture electric cars in the US, should Republicans come to power.

title: Biden Campaign Maps Out Expanded Battlefields for 2024 Race
description: President Joe Biden hopes to win reelection in 2024 by defending his victories in 2020 battleground states — but also expanding the map into states like North Carolina and Florida that Democrats haven’t won since Barack Obama.

title: Senators Urge Biden to Appoint Independent Banking Investigator
description: Two senators on the Banking Committee say they have found flaws in regulators’ oversight reviews before some of the recent bank failures, and are asking President Joe Biden to appoint an independent investigator.

title: The Debt-Ceiling Standoffs Threaten American Prestige
description: Recurring struggles over the borrowing limit undermine the status of the US as an economic superpower.

title: Sunak Says UK Talking to EU on Post-Brexit Rules for Carmakers
description: Rishi Sunak said his UK government is in talks with the European Union about Brexit-related rules that have triggered warnings from carmakers about the impact of looming tariffs on their profitability.

title: G-7 Latest: Leaders Arrive With China, Russia at Top of Agenda
description: US President Joe Biden and other Group of Seven leaders began arriving in the Japanese city of Hiroshima on Thursday for an annual summit, with concerns around China and Russia  — both uninvited — set to dominate discussions.

title: Ukraine Recap: Kyiv Downs Missiles, China Envoy Meets Zelenskiy
description: Air defense intercepted 29 out of 30 missiles fired by Russian forces overnight, Ukraine’s army chief Valeriy Zaluzhnyi said. Kyiv and other areas were targeted. One person was killed by a missile attack on the southern port city of Odesa.

title: Australia to Boost Philippine Coast Guard Amid China Sea Tension
description: Australia will provide drone equipment and training to boost the Philippines’ sea capabilities, Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong said, amid elevated tensions in disputed waters.

title: How Thailand’s Election Winner Used TikTok to Eke Rare Progressive Triumph
description: Thailand’s election-winning Move Forward Party had a TikTok advantage: while all the country’s big parties used social media to get their message out, Move Forward did it more effectively and creatively, helping it capture younger voters and outperform pre-balloting polls.

title: UK Announces Japan Chips Partnership as Fears Grow Over Taiwan
description: Rishi Sunak announced £18 billion ($22.5 billion) of new investment by Japanese businesses in the UK, mostly in clean energy, as well as a bilateral “semiconductor partnership” aimed at boosting supply chain resilience amid fears over Chinese interference in Taiwan.

title: Uganda’s Anti-LGBTQ Bill Threatens Tourism as Well as Lives
description: Legislation imposing jail time or death on queer individuals is creating a risky atmosphere of heightened vigilante justice. Even waiting to be passed, it’s already hurting the travel industry.

title: Thai Coalition on Course to Form Government, PM Candidate Says
description: A coalition of Thai pro-democracy parties, which swept Sunday’s election, is on course to form the next government, its leader Pita Limjaroenrat said, seeknig to quell concerns about its ability to muster enough support to elect him as the prime minister.

title: China to Immediately Allow Australian Timber Imports in Latest Sign of Thawing Ties
description: In the latest sign of a thaw in economic and diplomatic relations, Australian timber exports to China will be allowed to resume immediately after more than two years of restrictions.

title: Pakistan Latest: Imran Khan Arrest Fears Keep Nation on Edge
description: Pakistan’s former premier Imran Khan said he fears imminent arrest after police surrounded his home in Punjab province, stoking concerns of a repeat of the violent clashes seen between his supporters and security forces last week.

title: Key Thai Party Won’t Join Pita’s Coalition Over Monarchy Stance
description: The bid of Pita Limjaroenrat, leader of Thailand’s opposition group Move Forward, to form a coalition government hit a setback when a key political party said it won’t back a prime minister who wants to relax the law against criticizing the monarchy.

title: Chinese Police Arrest Woman Who Defended Comic’s Military Joke
description: Chinese authorities have arrested a woman for insulting the People’s Liberation Army, after she defended a comedian’s joke about a Xi Jinping military slogan that caused a national outcry.

title: China’s Envoy Kicks off Ukraine Mission With Kuleba Meeting
description: China’s Ambassador Li Hui met Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba in Kyiv Tuesday and Wednesday, kicking off a wider European tour aimed at brokering peace.

title: Here’s What to Watch for at the G-7 Summit in Japan
description: Leaders of some of the world’s most advanced economies gather in the Japanese city of Hiroshima from Friday facing a clutch of collective challenges.

title: Ecuador’s Top Court to Review the Legality of Closing Congress
description: Ecuador’s Constitutional Court will review whether President Guillermo Lasso’s decree to close the opposition-held congress was legal, according to the filing on the court’s website.
